Incident.Summary: Check The Welfare Resulting In DUI Arrest.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: *****INCIDENT CAPTURED ON IN CAR CAMERA#7458 AND BODY WORN CAMERA #7467***** My Body Worn Camera Was Having Malfunction Issues Driver: William Joel Gee 3rd Maryland Soundex MD10272675059 DUI#23-360 Narrative On Saturday, November 4th, 2023, at approximately 1656 hours,I, Tpr.Reid #7458 of the Maryland State Police currently assigned to the Forestville Barrack (Marked MSP patrol vehicle L-27). was dispatched to Southbound I-495 At Pennsylvania Ave, Prince Georges County Maryland in reference to a unresponsive driver behind the steering wheel. When I arrived on scene I observed a Burgandy Lincoln (MD 8FC5467) on the shoulder. I woke up the driver of the Burgandy Lincoln Continental who I identified by his MVA profile as William Joel Gee 3rd (DOB 03/30/1985). I approached the driver side of the Burgandy Lincoln Continental and observed that the driver was slumped over the wheel. I knocked on the windshield numerous times until the driver woke up. Gee 3rd stated that he was on his way to his aunts house and felt tired, so he pulled over. Gee 3rd advised he took Gabapentin one-hour prior to driving.As I spoke to Gee 3rd, I detected an odor of alcoholic beverage emanating from the vehicle.I asked Gee 3rd if he had any alcoholic beverages prior to driving, Gee 3rd stated he had a drink around 8am. I asked Gee 3rd if he would be willing to participate in Standardized Field Sobriety Testing and he agreed. The test was conducted on a flat dry surface free of debris. My patrol vehicle was positioned in a safe manner, with my forward emergency lights deactivated during all three tests. I asked Gee 3rd if he had any physical injuries that would prevent him from performing the test. Gee 3rd advised No. I then asked if he was taking any medications, Gee 3rd stated he takes medication HIV, Blood Pressure and Gabapentin. Gee 3rd was not wearing glasses at the time of standardized field sobriety tests. Gee 3rd also advised he does not wear contacts. Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus (6 of 6 clues observed) The first test was the Horizontal Gaze Nystagmus Test. The tip of my pen was used as the tests stimulus and held approximately 12 inches from Gee 3rdeyes. Gee 3rdwas instructed to look straight ahead keep his head still while focusing on the tip of the stimulus with his eyes only. Gee 3rdwas instructed to follow the tip of the pen with his eyes only until told to stop. Gee 3rdpupils were of equal size and showed equal tracking. Gee 3rd was positioned in a manner to ensure the headlights of passing traffic would not interfere with the results. 335552541:1,335559683:0,335559684:-2,335559685:720,335559991:360,469769226:Calibri,469769242:[8226],469777803:left,469777804:-,469777815:hybridMultilevel}" data-listid="1" role="listitem"> Lack of smooth pursuit in both eyes 335552541:1,335559683:0,335559684:-2,335559685:720,335559991:360,469769226:Calibri,469769242:[8226],469777803:left,469777804:-,469777815:hybridMultilevel}" data-listid="1" role="listitem"> Distinct and sustained nystagmus at maximum deviation in both eyes 335552541:1,335559683:0,335559684:-2,335559685:720,335559991:360,469769226:Calibri,469769242:[8226],469777803:left,469777804:-,469777815:hybridMultilevel}" data-listid="1" role="listitem"> Onset of nystagmus prior to 45 degrees in both eyes 335552541:1,335559683:0,335559684:-2,335559685:720,335559991:360,469769226:Calibri,469769242:[8226],469777803:left,469777804:-,469777815:hybridMultilevel}" data-listid="1" role="listitem"> Vertical gaze nystagmus present Walk And Turn (4 of 8 clues observed) Prior to Gee 3rd performing the test, I clearly explained and demonstrated how the test should be performed twice. Gee 3rd was instructed to place his right foot directly in front of his left foot and touch heel to toe. Gee 3rd was instructed and demonstrated to place his hands flat at his sides and remain in that position until told to begin. Gee 3rd was instructed to keep his hands flat at his sides, keep his eyes focused on his feet, and to count every step aloud. On the ninth step, Gee 3rd was instructed to take a series of small steps around with his rear foot to turn completely around. Gee 3rd was instructed that the second series of nine steps were to be formed identical to the first series of nine steps. Gee 3rd was instructed that once the test started, that he should not stop walking until the test was completed. Gee 3rd was asked if he understood my instructions of the test and he stated, Yes. Instruction Phase 335551671:1,335552541:0,335559683:0,335559684:-1,335559685:720,335559991:360,469769226:Times New Roman,469769242:[65533,0],469777803:left,469777804:%1.,469777815:hybridMultilevel}" data-listid="5" role="listitem"> Starts too soon Walking Phase 2. Misses heel to toe 3. Wrong number of steps 4. Improper turn One Leg Stand (2 of 4 clues observed) Prior to Gee 3rd performing this test, I properly explained and demonstrated to Gee 3rd how the test should be conducted. Gee 3rd was instructed to stand with his feet together and hands down by his side while I provided instructions. I explained and demonstrated to Gee 3rdwhen I told him, he was to lift a foot of his choice off the ground approximately 6 inches off the ground and make it flat and parallel to the ground. I advised Gee 3rd to look down at his foot, keep arms by his side and count aloud one-one thousand, two-one thousand, and so until I advised him to stop. I asked Gee 3rdif he understood the instructions that were given, he stated Yes. Gee 3rd displayed the following: 335551671:1,335552541:0,335559683:0,335559684:-1,335559685:720,335559991:360,469769226:Times New Roman,469769242:[65533,0],469777803:left,469777804:%1.,469777815:hybridMultilevel}" data-listid="6" role="listitem"> Swayed While Balancing 335551671:1,335552541:0,335559683:0,335559684:-1,335559685:720,335559991:360,469769226:Times New Roman,469769242:[65533,0],469777803:left,469777804:%1.,469777815:hybridMultilevel}" data-listid="6" role="listitem"> Puts Foot Down After the standardized field sobriety tests, Gee 3rd was offered to take the Preliminary Breath Test (PBT), which Gee 3rd did not elect to take. Gee 3rd was arrested at 1736hours on 11/04/2023 and transported to MSP Forestville for processing. Gee 3rd was placed in the front seat passenger seat per department policy and transported to the Maryland State Police Forestville Barrack. For the 20-minute observation period I did not observe Gee 3rd regurgitate or place anything in his mouth. Once At MSP Forestville, Gee 3rd elected to listen to an English audio recording of the DR15. Gee 3rd refused to take the intoximeter examination and signed to sign the DR 15 At 1806 hours on 11/04/23. Gee 3rd was provided with a copy of the DR15 and DR15. Gee 3rd slept through recording. Gee 3rd was given his paperwork and explained the forthcoming process. He was released from the Barrack to a licensed sober driver. Charges: TA-21-901.1(b)-Negligent Driving Vehicle In Careless And Imprudent Manner Endangering Property, Life And Person (13C0Y1Z) TA-21-902(a1i)-Driving Vehicle While Under The Influence Of Alcohol (13D0Y1Z) TA-21-902(c1i)-Driving, Attempting To Drive Veh While So Far Impaired By Alcohol Cannot Drive Safely (13F0Y1Z) TA-21-902(d1i)-Driving Veh. While Impaired By A Controlled Dangerous Substance (13G0Y1Z) TA-13-401(h)-Driving Vehicle On Highway With Suspended Registration (13H0Y1Z) All events occurred in Prince Georges County, Maryland Cleared by an arrest.
